TITLE.P: Framework Agreement for Removal, Disposal, Supply and Installation of Metal and/or Timber Fencing

SHORT_DESCR.P: 4 year framework agreement for the Removal, Disposal, Supply and Installation of Metal and/or Timber Fencing within Falkirk Council areas of operation.
1. Metal Treated Fencing and Gates; and
Services will include but are not limited to:
— CAT scan to locate and avoid any buried services,
— removal of existing timber, concrete / brick or metal fencing or walls and hedging, include removing posts, foundations and debris and reinstating ground,
— Supply and Erect New Timber or Metal Fencing.

TITLE.P: Lot 1: Metal Treated Fencing and Gates

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 1: Metal Treated Fencing and Gates:
— CAT scan to locate and avoid any buried services, to ensure all such cables are identified and not damaged,
— remove timber, metal posts and fencing, concrete / brick walls, or hedging; include removing posts, foundations and debris and reinstating ground,
— subsequent safe removal and environmentally friendly disposal of all materials, to recycling plant or scrap,
— Supply and Erect New Metal Fencing.

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: A) Timescale Management, Management of Agreement, Quality Assurance, Risk Management
B) Employment Practices and Workforce Matters

INFO_ADD.P: Scoring: Pricing Document 75 %, Qualitative 25 %.

SUITABILITY.P: It is a requirement of this tender that if the Bidder is UK based they must hold a valid registration with Companies House. Where the Bidder is UK based but not registered at Companies House they must be able to verify to the Council’s satisfaction that they are trading from the address provided in the tender and under the Company name given.
Bidders will provide evidence of relevant qualifications / experience for all operatives undertaking Fencing services, including subcontractors, to the Authority with their tender submission.
Contractor's personnel in charge of the management and supervision of services being provided must be suitably qualified and experienced.

The Bidder will provide the relevant certification that all operatives proposed to be undertaking services, including Sub-contractors, have undertaken Asbestos Awareness Training, to the Authority with their tender bid.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The Selection Criteria is outlined in the appendix ESPD document:
Bidders will be required to state the annual turnover of the bidding entity for the last 3 years (ESPD 4B.1.1).
Where turnover information is not available for the time period requested, the bidder will be required to state the date on which they were set up / started trading.

A Creditsafe credit scoring check will be ran on registered Company Name and Company Number provided by the bidder. Where the resulting Credit Rating Score is less than 30/100, the Bidder may be excluded from the tender process unless suitable financial information is provided that give satisfactory assurances to the Council regarding financial risk in appointing the bidder to the proposed Framework.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Public Contracts Regulations 2015 state that before awarding the contract, the Contracting Authority shall require the tenderer(s) to submit up to date supporting documents. This includes the insurance requirements stated in ESPD (4B.5):

Professional Indemnity Insurance = 1 000 000 GBP. Professional Indemnity Insurance is correctly required for agreements / contracts where advice or services such as those involved in Installation of Metal and/or Timber Fencing is provided. A 6 year run off policy is required.
Bidders who do not meet the criteria above may be excluded from further participation in this procurement exercise.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: The bidder must hold a UKAS (or equivalent) accredited independent third party certificate of compliance in accordance with BS OHSAS 18001 (or equivalent) or have within the last 12 months successfully met the assessment requirements of a construction — related scheme in registered membership of the Safety Schemes in Procurement (SSIP) forum OR provide responses in relation to 4D.1.4A through to L in the Appendix ESPD (Scotland) Standard Statements v1.9.
Any recorded fail shall result in your submission being non compliant and excluded from the process.

Community Benefits requirements:

All Contractors on the Framework who’s cumulative level of spend is greater than 100 000 GBP but less than 200 000 GBP will be required to provide at least twelve (Nº 12) weeks of work experience. The Contractor will be required to meet with Falkirk Council’s Employment and Training Unit to discuss implementation prior to contract start.

All Contractors on the Framework who’s cumulative level of spend is greater than 200 000 GBP but less than 500 000 GBP will be required to provide at least twenty-six (Nº 26) weeks of training. The Contractor will be required to meet with Falkirk Council’s Employment and Training Unit to discuss implementation prior to contract start.

All Contractors on the Framework will be required to provide the following Modern Apprenticeship opportunities when the cumulative level of spend detailed below is reached. MA’s are to be obtained from a source agreed by the Council. The MA placement can be across a range of disciplines to be determined by the successful Contractor. The Contractor will be required to meet with Falkirk Council’s Employment and Training Unit to discuss implementation prior to contract start.
1st MA when cumulative spend reaches 500 000 GBP.
2nd MA when cumulative spend reaches 1 000 000 GBP.
